description: Mass chant (a generic code used in the earliest Cantus inventories, to be reassigned)
Verse of a Mass chant (a generic code used in the earliest Cantus inventories, to be reassigned)
Miscellaneous (a generic code used in the earliest Cantus inventories, to be reassigned)
Mass Ordinary (a generic code used in the earliest Cantus inventories, to be reassigned)
Versus ad repetendum for the communion
Cantio, Cantiones (paraliturgical sacred songs with poetic and often strophic Latin or vernacular texts)
Cantio Verse (strophe of paraliturgical sacred poetic text)
Dramatic element (used for items of liturgical drama that are not otherwise rubricked)
Hymn (and hymn verses if listed together in the same record)
Hymn (Hispanic rite, but to be merged with Franco-Roman rite) - work in progress
Versus ad repetendum for the Introit
Invitatory psalm (when written out and notated)
Litany (and litany verses if listed together in the same record)
Oratio / Prayer (when written out and notated)
Pater noster (when written out and notated)
Trope (broadly); see also specific types of tropes, such as Psl (prosula) and TpBD (troped Benedicamus domino)

Versus (Hispanic rite, applied to a number of quite different types of pieces in the sources, including single verses of Scripture not attached to any parent chant as well as more lengthy poetic texts; seebRandel, Index, xvii)
